name: Creamy Lemon Chicken Pasta
description: A delicious blend of sauteed chicken and light, but creamy, lemon sauce and pasta, baked til the top is crispy and lightly browned. Asparagus or broccoli is a great addition to this dish. Serve topped with a little extra lemon juice if desired.
recipeIngredient: ½ teaspoon salt, or to taste
⅛ teaspoon ground black pepper, or to taste
3 cloves garlic, minced, or more to taste
2 cups chicken stock, or more as needed
½ teaspoon crushed red pepper, or to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste
¾ cup grated Parmesan cheese, divided

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a casserole dish or 9x13-inch pan.
Slice or cube chicken and season lightly with 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/8 teaspoon pepper.
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook farfalle at a boil, stirring occasionally, for 6 minutes. Drain, cover, and set aside.

Heat butter and olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook until lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Add wine and cook, 1 to 2 minutes. Add garlic and lemon juice and cook, 1 to 2 minutes. Don't allow garlic to brown.

Reduce heat to medium-low and add cream cheese, stirring until melted and blended. Add flour to sour cream, mix well, and stir into the pan. Add chicken stock, parsley, thyme, red pepper, salt, and pepper. Bring to a simmer until slightly thickened. Add more stock if sauce is too thick. Remove from heat.

Add 1/2 cup Parmesan and lemon zest, stir well. Taste and adjust seasoning. Add partially cooked farfalle and blend well. Pour into the prepared baking or casserole pan and sprinkle with remaining Parmesan cheese.
Bake, covered, in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Uncover and continue to bake until lightly browned, 7 to 10 minutes more.

review.reviewBody: In my quest to find a chicken casserole that doesn't begin with Cream of Mushroom Soup or taste like chicken pot pie, I saw this recipe promo'ed by All Recipes on Facebook. This was fantastic! Every direction and amount was perfect! True 5-star. I did need to add about 1/3-1/2 cup more chicken stock, but that was it. I would strongly encourage folks to try this. It's rare on All Recipes to find a submission that doesn't need any changes, but Creamy Lemon Chicken Pasta is it.
My family and I absolutely loved this dish!  We like our casseroles creamy, so I doubled the sauce recipe and used about 3/4 cup of lemon juice.  I will be making this often!

I used stuffed ravioli instead of orzo, and I used chopped veggies (zucchini, peppers, onion) in place of the chicken bc I didn’t have any, and followed the rest of the recipe as stated. When it got to the Parmesan cheese, I only had the shaker kind (and I assume the recipe means shredded) so I used that bc it’s what I had. Then, instead of baking, I just spooned the veggies and sauce on top of the drained pasta. I thought it was very good, even without chicken! Hubby however- loves meat more than veggies and thinks it was good but would be better with chicken. Lol
Did everything according to the recipe, but I substituted spiral pasta for farfalle. Absolutely delicious and will definitely make again!
Loved it but I made my own version. I added cut up prosciutto to it. I did not bake, I covered it in the pan and let it simmer on low for about 5 minutes.
